sense.name: Have a tendency or disposition.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[topic[animate]] be INCLINE [predicate] NOTE: Compare to sense 5, in this sense there can only be one argument (one noun phrase) which comes before 'incline'.
sense.examples: She is inclined to be nervous before her lectures. He is inclined to defend floating rates to the death. After the punishment the child was inclined to obey.

sense.name: Bend or turn toward a speaker for better hearing.
sense.examples: Incline your ear to wisdom. O my God, incline Your ear and hear! I will incline my ear to a proverb.

sense.name: Nod or bow.
sense.examples: He inclined to the leader. Japanese workers incline to management.

sense.name: Be at an angle
sense.examples: The terrain inclined down the mountain.

sense.name: Make receptive or willing toward an action or belief.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] INCLINE NP2 [predicate] NOTE: Compare to sense 1, in this sense 'incline' requires 2 arguments (two noun phrases) one before and one after the verb.
sense.examples: Their language inclines us to believe them. Our biology inclines us one way and our common sense another. We are appalled by killing, yet something inclines us to kill.
